p.k: St. Petersburg Philharmonic Orchestra, Yuri Temirkanov
p.d: On the eve of the 300th anniversary, the city of Saint Petersburg, the Russian 'window to Europe', celebrated its jubilee with a great musical spectacle. The creme de la creme of Russia's classical music scene came together in St. Petersburg to celebrate this special anniversary together with the time-honoured St. Petersburg Philharmonic led by conductors Yuri Temirkanov and Nikolai Alekseev. One of the most prominent performers in the opera gala was Russian star baritone Dmitri Hvorostovsky. Here he sings the famous 'Yeletsky's Aria' from the second act of Tchaikovsky's esteemed opera 'Queen of Spades'. Tchaikovsky composed this opera to the short story of famous Russian author Alexander Pushkin. His brother Modest wrote the Russian libretto. The premiere was in St. Petersburg in 1890.
